conclusion: Problem involves shadows cast by objects on a concrete slab and how they change when the light source moves.
There are four objects labeled A, B, C, and D with corresponding shadows.
Scene includes a pack of Marlboro cigarettes, a single cigarette, an egg, and a blue alarm clock.
There is cracking on the concrete slab.
Objects are placed on a concrete slab with a light source casting shadows.
Positions of shadows suggest light source is coming from the left side.
Object A is an egg with shadow labeled A positioned to the right.
Shadow A is cast towards the right assuming light is coming from the left.
Object B appears to be a blue alarm clock with shadow labeled B cast towards the right.
Object C is another part of the alarm clock with shadow labeled C.
Object D seems to be another component of the alarm clock with shadow labeled D.
Light source moves to the right and directly above the objects.
Shadows will change in terms of location and size when light source moves.
Shadow A should shift to directly below the egg when light is directly above.
Shadows B, C, and D should also shift to directly below each object when light is directly above.
Alarm clock has multiple protrusions that might cast complex shadows.
